sentence: Stocks look set to give back some of yesterday's gains after President Donald J. Trumpthreatened to shut down the government to get a border wall built and said that NAFTA might need to be terminated if it can't be renegotiated.
S&P 500 futures have dropped 0.3%, while Dow Jones Industrial Average futures have declined 0.3%.
DSW (DSW) has risen 2% to $18.80 after getting upgraded to Buy from Neutral at B. Riley following yesterday's earnings-inspired double-digit gain.
Express (EXPR) has soared 24% to $6.85 after its earnings and sales topped Street expectations.
Lowe's (LOW) has tumbled 6.2% to $71.12 after its earnings and sales fell short of analyst forecasts.
Lowe's also offered below-consensus full-year guidance.
La-Z-Boy (LZB) has plunged 19% to $25.35 after reporting below-consensus earnings and sales.
Salesforce.com (CRM) has declined 1.7% to $91.41 despite beating earnings forecasts and offering above-consensus guidance.
